elements.title: SupersPort (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zenith Data Systems unveiled their SupersPort laptop (example pictured) at a Chicago show that featured helmeted performers and motorcyclists?

elements.title: Jack Emanuel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Australian official Jack Emanuel was awarded the George Cross in 1971 after being stabbed to death whilst trying to resolve a land dispute with the Tolai people of New Guinea?

elements.title: Down Will Come Baby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1999 television film Down Will Come Baby aired two weeks after the Columbine High School massacre and was criticized for exploiting parental fears with its depiction of child violence?

elements.title: Gürdal Duyar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to one Turkish artist, a nude sculpture by Gürdal Duyar almost dissolved the 37th government of Turkey?

elements.title: An Appeal for Human Rights (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that An Appeal for Human Rights was published by college students in 1960 in response to racial inequality in Atlanta?

elements.title: Gyalectidium yahriae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the uncommon Florida lichen species Gyalectidium yahriae was named after Rebecca Yahr of the Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh in Scotland?

elements.title: Hanford Engineer Works (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that plutonium produced in the nuclear reactors at the Hanford Engineer Works was used in the Fat Man bomb used in the atomic bombing of Nagasaki in August 1945?

elements.title: Xu Dachun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Qing-dynasty physician Xu Dachun, "stupid people believe that expensive drugs must be good drugs"?
